name: Dradis
summary: Dradis is an open-source collaboration and reporting platform designed for security professionals. It centralizes findings from multiple tools, enables team collaboration, and generates professional reports for penetration testing engagements.

installation_guides.summary: Install via Ruby gems or use the CE (Community Edition) package.

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y git ruby ruby-dev build-essential libsqlite3-dev nodejs
cd dradis-ce && gem install bundler && bundle install

installation_guides.summary: Pre-installed on Kali or install via gem with dependencies.
Run Dradis CE in containerized environment for isolation.
Commercial Pro/Teams edition with advanced features and support.

steps.detail: # Follow installation wizard for Pro edition

quick_examples.command: # Upload > Import from file > Select nmap.xml
# Projects > New Project > Enter name and details

operational_tips: Create separate projects for each engagement or client.
Use templates to standardize finding formats and methodologies.
Import tool outputs early to avoid manual data entry.
Tag findings with CVSS scores and remediation priorities.
Collaborate with team members using notes and comments.
Export reports in multiple formats (HTML, PDF, Word) for client delivery.
Backup projects regularly; database corruption can occur.
Use attachments to include screenshots and evidence files.
Customize report templates to match organizational branding.
Pro edition offers real-time collaboration and advanced integrations.

step_sequences.title: Project setup and tool import workflow

steps.title: Create new project
steps.details: Initialize project workspace for engagement.
steps.command: # Projects > New Project > Name: Client Pentest 2024

steps.title: Define project structure
steps.details: Organize nodes representing networks, hosts, and services.

steps.title: Import Nmap results
steps.details: Upload Nmap XML to automatically populate hosts and services.

steps.title: Import Nessus scan
steps.details: Add vulnerability data from Nessus or OpenVAS.

steps.title: Import Burp/ZAP findings
steps.details: Merge web application vulnerabilities into project.
steps.command: # Upload > Import from File > burp_report.xml or zap_report.xml

steps.title: Review imported data
steps.details: Verify all findings populated correctly in project tree.
steps.command: # Navigate nodes to review hosts, services, vulnerabilities

steps.title: Create new note
steps.details: Document manual findings not captured by automated tools.

steps.title: Use templates
steps.details: Apply predefined templates for common vulnerability types.
steps.command: # Note editor > Apply template: SQL Injection, XSS, etc.

steps.title: Add evidence
steps.details: Attach screenshots, code snippets, and proof-of-concept.

steps.title: Set severity and CVSS
steps.details: Assign risk ratings using CVSS calculator or custom scale.
steps.command: # Note fields > Severity: Critical/High/Medium/Low, CVSS Score

steps.title: Include remediation
steps.details: Provide actionable recommendations for fixing vulnerability.

steps.title: Invite team members
steps.details: Add collaborators to project with appropriate permissions.

steps.title: Assign findings
steps.details: Delegate verification or testing tasks to team members.

steps.title: Add comments
steps.details: Collaborate via threaded comments on findings.

steps.title: Track status
steps.details: Update finding status as testing progresses.
steps.command: # Note > Status: New, In Progress, Verified, False Positive

steps.title: Review before reporting
steps.details: Team lead reviews all findings before report generation.
steps.command: # Filter by Status: Ready for Report

steps.title: Select report template
steps.details: Choose from built-in or custom report templates.
steps.command: # Export > Select template: Executive Summary, Technical Report, Compliance

steps.title: Configure report options
steps.details: Set scope, include/exclude findings, customize sections.
steps.command: # Report options > Include: Executive Summary, Findings, Appendices

steps.title: Generate report
steps.details: Export report in desired format (HTML, Word, PDF).

steps.title: Review and edit
steps.details: Proofread exported report and make manual edits if needed.
steps.command: # Open exported document, review formatting and content

steps.title: Deliver to client
steps.details: Package report with executive summary and technical appendices.
steps.command: # Compile final deliverables for client handoff

stages.label: Project initialization
stages.description: Create project structure and define scope.
stages.command: # New Project > Define networks, hosts, applications in scope

stages.label: Tool output aggregation
stages.description: Import results from Nmap, Nessus, Burp, Metasploit, etc.

stages.label: Manual testing documentation
stages.description: Add findings from manual testing and exploitation.
stages.command: # Create notes with templates, attach evidence

stages.label: Collaborative review
stages.description: Team validates findings, removes false positives.

stages.label: Report generation
stages.description: Produce executive and technical reports.

stages.label: Create baseline project
stages.description: Document initial security posture.

stages.label: Import quarterly scans
stages.description: Add new findings from ongoing assessments.
stages.command: # Upload > Import Q2, Q3, Q4 scan results

stages.label: Track remediation
stages.description: Update finding statuses as vulnerabilities are fixed.

stages.label: Generate trend reports
stages.description: Show security improvement over time.

output_notes.meaning: Tool output imported correctly; review node tree for completeness.
Report successfully created; download and review before delivery.
Dradis version updated; run migrations to update database schema.
File size or type restriction; check configuration or resize image.

advanced_usage.title: Custom report templates
advanced_usage.scenario: Create branded report templates with organizational styling.
advanced_usage.command: # Templates > New Template > Edit HTML/ERB template files
notes: Templates use ERB (Embedded Ruby) for dynamic content.
Customize CSS for branding and layout.
Test templates with sample projects before production use.

advanced_usage.title: API integration for automation
advanced_usage.scenario: Automate project creation and finding import via REST API.
advanced_usage.command: curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/projects -H 'Authorization: Bearer TOKEN' -d '{"project":{"name":"Auto Project"}}'
notes: Generate API tokens in user settings.
Automate report generation in CI/CD pipelines.
Integrate with ticketing systems for vulnerability tracking.

advanced_usage.title: Custom plugin development
advanced_usage.scenario: Create plugins to import proprietary tool formats.
advanced_usage.command: # Develop Ruby plugin following Dradis plugin architecture
notes: Study existing plugins in /app/uploaders/ directory.
Implement upload and parsing methods for custom format.
Test plugin thoroughly before deploying to production.

advanced_usage.title: Database backup and migration
advanced_usage.scenario: Regular backups to prevent data loss during upgrades.
advanced_usage.command: bundle exec rake db:backup && bundle exec rake db:migrate
notes: Schedule automated backups before upgrades.
Store backups on separate infrastructure.
Test restore procedures periodically.

resources.description: Community Edition source code and issue tracker.

resources.label: Plugin Directory
resources.description: Browse available tool integrations and plugins.

name: Faraday
summary: Faraday is an Integrated Penetration-Test Environment (IPE) that combines security tools, manages vulnerabilities, enables team collaboration, and integrates with numerous pentesting tools for centralized workspace management.

installation_guides.summary: Install via pip or Debian package for system-wide deployment.

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y python3-pip python3-venv postgresql
sudo systemctl start postgresql && sudo systemctl enable postgresql

installation_guides.summary: Pre-installed or installable via apt with full dependencies.

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y faraday

installation_guides.summary: Run Faraday in containerized environment with persistence.
Faraday Professional with advanced features and support.

operational_tips: Use workspaces to separate different engagements and clients.
Leverage native tool plugins for automatic import (nmap, nikto, burp, etc.).
Tag vulnerabilities for easy filtering and reporting.
Enable Faraday agent for real-time tool output capture.
Integrate with Metasploit for exploit management.
Export findings to CSV, JSON, or XML for external processing.
Use custom fields to track CVSS, remediation status, or compliance.
Professional edition offers API, LDAP, SSO, and advanced analytics.
Set up PostgreSQL properly for multi-user collaboration.
Regular backups are critical; Faraday stores all data in PostgreSQL.

steps.title: Initialize database
steps.details: Create PostgreSQL database and tables for Faraday.

steps.title: Create admin user
steps.details: Set up initial administrator account.

steps.title: Start Faraday server
steps.details: Launch web server for GUI access.

steps.title: Access web interface
steps.details: Open browser and log in to Faraday.

steps.title: Create workspace
steps.details: Set up isolated workspace for engagement.
steps.command: # Dashboard > Workspaces > New > Name: Client Pentest

steps.title: Install Faraday client
steps.details: Install client for command-line tool integration.

steps.title: Configure client
steps.details: Connect client to Faraday server and select workspace.

steps.title: Run tools with automatic import
steps.details: Execute pentesting tools with Faraday plugins enabled.

steps.title: Manual import from files
steps.details: Upload tool reports via web UI for parsing.
steps.command: # Workspace > Data > Import Reports > Upload files

steps.title: Review imported data
steps.details: Verify hosts, services, and vulnerabilities were imported.

steps.title: Review vulnerabilities
steps.details: Examine discovered vulnerabilities sorted by severity.

steps.title: Create manual vulnerability
steps.details: Document findings not captured by tools.

steps.title: Add evidence
steps.details: Attach screenshots, logs, and proof-of-concept.

steps.title: Set remediation status
steps.details: Track vulnerability lifecycle from discovery to fix.
steps.command: # Vulnerability > Status: Open, In Progress, Fixed, Risk Accepted

steps.title: Tag and categorize
steps.details: Apply tags for filtering and grouping.
steps.command: # Vulnerability > Tags: Web, Network, Critical, OWASP Top 10

steps.title: Create team members
steps.details: Add user accounts with appropriate roles.
steps.command: # Admin > Users > New User > Set role: Pentester, Admin, Client

steps.title: Share workspace
steps.details: Grant access to workspace for collaboration.

steps.title: Assign vulnerabilities
steps.details: Delegate testing or verification to team members.
steps.command: # Vulnerability > Owner: Assign to team member

steps.title: Comment and discuss
steps.details: Use comments for collaborative analysis.

steps.title: Generate vulnerability report
steps.details: Create comprehensive report from workspace data.
steps.command: # Reports > Generate > Select template and filters

steps.title: Export to external format
steps.details: Download data in CSV, JSON, or XML for processing.

steps.title: Executive dashboard
steps.details: View high-level metrics and trends.
steps.command: # Dashboard shows vulnerability distribution, severity stats

steps.title: Custom reports via API
steps.details: Use REST API for programmatic report generation.

workflow_guides.name: Faraday IDE Collaborative Penetration Testing Workflow

stages.label: Workspace initialization
stages.description: Create workspace, configure scope, add team members.

stages.label: Reconnaissance phase
stages.description: Run discovery scans with automatic Faraday import.

stages.label: Vulnerability scanning
stages.description: Execute vulnerability scanners and import results.

stages.label: Manual testing
stages.description: Document manual findings, add evidence, set severity.
stages.command: # Create vulnerabilities via web UI, attach PoCs

stages.label: Remediation tracking
stages.description: Update statuses as client fixes vulnerabilities.

stages.label: Final reporting
stages.description: Generate reports and export findings.

stages.label: Baseline workspace
stages.description: Create initial assessment workspace.

stages.label: Scheduled scanning
stages.description: Automate recurring scans via cron or CI/CD.
stages.command: # Cron job: faraday-cli tool run nmap -sV targets.txt

stages.label: Trend analysis
stages.description: Compare vulnerability counts over time.
stages.command: # Dashboard shows trends across time periods

stages.label: Remediation verification
stages.description: Re-scan to confirm fixes were effective.
stages.command: # Update statuses based on retest results

stages.label: Reconnaissance tools
stages.description: Integrate nmap, masscan, amass for discovery.
stages.command: faraday-cli tool run amass enum -d example.com

stages.label: Web scanners
stages.description: Import Burp, ZAP, Nikto, wpscan reports.

stages.label: Exploitation frameworks
stages.description: Connect Metasploit workspace to Faraday.

stages.label: Specialized tools
stages.description: Import SQLMap, Nessus, OpenVAS outputs.
stages.command: # Import tool outputs via web UI or CLI

output_notes.meaning: Tool output parsed and added to workspace; review for accuracy.
Server not running or network issue; check faraday-server status.
New workspace ready for data import and collaboration.
API token or credentials needed; run faraday-cli auth.

advanced_usage.title: REST API for automation
advanced_usage.scenario: Programmatically manage workspaces, vulnerabilities, and reports.
advanced_usage.command: curl -X POST -H 'Authorization: Token YOUR_TOKEN' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"name":"New Vuln","severity":"high"}' http://localhost:5985/api/v2/ws/workspace/vulns
notes: Generate API token in user profile settings.
Full API documentation available at /api/doc.
Automate vulnerability creation, updates, and exports.

advanced_usage.title: Custom tool plugins
advanced_usage.scenario: Create parsers for proprietary or unsupported tools.
advanced_usage.command: # Develop Python plugin following Faraday plugin structure in faraday_plugins/
notes: Study existing plugins for XML/JSON parsing examples.
Implement Plugin class with parseOutputString method.
Test plugin with sample tool outputs before deployment.

advanced_usage.title: Metasploit integration
advanced_usage.scenario: Synchronize Metasploit workspace with Faraday for exploit management.
advanced_usage.command:
msf> load faraday
msf> faraday_use workspace_name
notes: Install faraday-plugins gem in Metasploit environment.
All Metasploit findings automatically sync to Faraday.
View exploited hosts and sessions in Faraday web UI.

advanced_usage.title: LDAP/SSO integration (Professional)
notes: Professional edition required for LDAP/SSO.
Centralize user management with Active Directory.
Configure role mappings for automatic permissions.

advanced_usage.title: Custom fields and compliance mapping
advanced_usage.scenario: Track compliance requirements (PCI-DSS, HIPAA, etc.) per vulnerability.
advanced_usage.command: # Admin > Custom Fields > Add field: Compliance_Requirement
notes: Create dropdown fields for compliance frameworks.
Filter and report by compliance tags.
Export compliance-specific reports for auditors.
